data.title: Kurt Zouma set to join Shabab Al-Ahli from West Ham United
data.meta_description:
West Ham United defender Kurt Zouma is close to completing a move to Shabab Al-Ahli.

The centre-back was named West Ham captain at the start of last season following Declan Rice’s move to Arsenal.
He made 33 Premier League appearances for the east London club in 2023-24, scoring three goals.

data.text:
West Ham United defender Kurt Zouma is close to completing a move to Shabab Al-Ahli.

The 29-year-old, who has a year remaining on his West Ham contract, will join on a free transfer with the Dubai-based club covering the final 12 months of his wages.

The deal will be completed in the coming days with the France international set to undergo a medical.

The centre-back was named West Ham captain at the start of last season following Declan Rice’s move to Arsenal.

He made 33 Premier League appearances for the east London club in 2023-24, scoring three goals.

His departure helps West Ham improve their wage budget following the arrival of six summer signings, including centre-back Maximilian Kilman from Wolves.

The transfer ends his 10-year stay in English football having joined Chelsea from Saint-Etienne in 2014.

Zouma won two Premier League titles, the Champions League and the League Cup with the south west London club.

He went on to enjoy loan spells with Stoke City and Everton before completing a permanent move to West Ham in 2021, where he added a Europa Conference League winner’s medal in 2023.

In 2022, he was ordered to serve 180 hours of community service after he pleaded guilty to kicking and slapping his cat.

(Alex Davidson/Getty Images)
